gujarati.couplet:
દુરવાસાના શાપથી, ઋષિએ ધર્યા હતા દેહ<RHYME_210692>; 
તેહ મળ્યા છે મહારાજને, કરી અતિશે સનેહ<RHYME_210692>.
gujarati.context: The sage's body was possessed by the curse of the wicked; he gave it to the king, and with great affection, his love was born.

gujarati.couplet:
એવા સંત શિરોમણિ, તેનાં તે કહું હવે નામ<RHYME_210693>; 
તે સાંભળતાં સુખ ઊપજે, વળી પામે પરમ ધામ<RHYME_210693>.
gujarati.context: A saint's name is now mine to claim; with his guidance, I will find ultimate peace and happiness.

gujarati.couplet:
મોટા મુક્ત મહારાજના, ભાઈ રામદાસ અકામ<RHYME_210694>; 
પંચવ્રતની મૂરતિ, જેને વહાલા સુંદર શ્યામ<RHYME_210694>.
gujarati.context:
Here is a summarization of the Gujarati couplet in English:

Ramdas, a humble devotee, serves the great emperor without expecting anything in return.
The beautiful Shyam, who has the beauty of Panchvarta, is cherished by everyone.

gujarati.couplet:
મુક્તાનંદ છે નામ મુખ્ય, શુકમુનિ આદિ અપાર<RHYME_210695>; 
સુંદર નામ સહુ સાંભળો , કહું નામ તણો નિરધાર<RHYME_210695>.
gujarati.context: The name "Muktaanand" is the main concern, with names like Shukmuni and others being countless; Listen carefully to a beautiful name, as I have already fixed it in my heart.

gujarati.couplet:
સ્વરૂપાનંદ ને વ્યાપકાનંદ<RHYME_210696>, બ્રહ્માનંદ ને ગોવિંદ<RHYME_210696>; 
નિત્યાનંદ ને ચૈતન્યાનંદ<RHYME_210696>, શાંતાનંદ ને આનંદ<RHYME_210696>.
gujarati.context: The couplet describes the different forms of bliss one can experience: Swarupanand is boundless joy, Brahmaanand is divine joy, Nityaanand is eternal joy, and Shantaanand is peaceful joy.

gujarati.couplet:
શુકાનંદ નિરંજનાનંદ<RHYME_210697>, અદ્વૈતાનંદ એ નામ છે; 
અચ્યુતાનંદ અનંતાનંદ<RHYME_210697>, આત્માનંદ અકામ છે.
gujarati.context: Shukanand and Nirnjanaand are two names for the ultimate truth; Atmanand is the name for joy that comes from fulfilling one's desires.

gujarati.couplet:
અચિંત્યાનંદ ને અમોઘાનંદ<RHYME_210699>, અખંડાનંદ અજિત જે; 
અદ્‍ભુતાનંદ અરિહન્ત્રાનંદ<RHYME_210699>, ગોપાળાનંદ બ્રહ્મવિત્ જે.
gujarati.context: The ultimate bliss is achieved through the realization of the self, and it is characterized by a sense of eternal happiness and tranquility. This state is attained only when one's ego and worldly attachments are completely dissolved.

gujarati.couplet:
અરૂપાનંદ અનુભવાનંદ<RHYME_210701>, અક્ષરાનંદ આધારજી; 
અપરાનંદ અષ્ટાવક્રાનંદ<RHYME_210701>, આદિત્યાનંદ ઉદારજી.
gujarati.context: The couplet describes the joy of experiencing God's presence through various forms and manifestations, from the infinite (arupanand) to the written word (akshranand).

gujarati.couplet:
અચળાનંદ અવધૂતાનંદ<RHYME_210703>, અજન્માનંદ અજિતમુનિ; 
અખિલાનંદ અમૂર્તાનંદ<RHYME_210703>, એમ નંદ સંજ્ઞા સહુની.
gujarati.context: Delight in the joy of the present moment and be free from the anxieties of birth or death; this is the understanding that brings true happiness.

gujarati.couplet:
અખિલબ્રહ્માંડેશ્વરાનંદ, આકાશાનંદ ૐકારાનંદજી; 
એક એકમાં અપાર બીજાં, નામનાં છે વૃંદજી.
gujarati.context: The entire universe is filled with bliss and joy, from the highest heavens to the lowest earth. Each individual has a unique name and identity, like a seed in its own special soil.

gujarati.couplet:
વીર્યાનંદ વૈષ્ણવાનંદ<RHYME_210705>, વિશ્વાસચૈતન્યાનંદ છે; 
વૈરાગ્યાનંદ ને વલ્લભાનંદ<RHYME_210705>, વિશ્વરૂપાનંદ સ્વચ્છંદ છે.
gujarati.context: Viryanand is full of faith and enthusiasm; Vallabhanand, filled with renunciation, is pure and radiant like the universe.

gujarati.couplet:
સ્વયંપ્રકાશાનંદ સદાનંદ, પ્રજ્ઞાનંદ પરમાનંદ વળી; 
પરમચૈતન્યાનંદ નામ<RHYME_210693>, પરમહંસ બોળાં મળી.
gujarati.context: Self-illumination brings eternal bliss, and self-awareness leads to supreme happiness. The name of ultimate enlightenment is Param Chaitanya, the highest state of consciousness.

gujarati.couplet:
વેદાંતાનંદ વૈકુંઠાનંદ<RHYME_210707>, કૈવલ્યાનંદ કૃષ્ણાનંદ કહીએ<RHYME_210708>; 
મહાનુભાવાનંદ મુકુંદાનંદ<RHYME_210707>, જ્ઞાનાનંદ ઘણા લહીએ<RHYME_210708>.
gujarati.context: The couplet describes the bliss and joy that comes from understanding God (Vedantanda) or gaining knowledge (Jnanaanda). It expresses the idea that true happiness arises from the connection with a higher power or profound insight.

gujarati.couplet:
ભગવદાનંદ ભાગેશ્વરાનંદ<RHYME_210709>, શિવાનંદ બહુ સંગન્યા; 
શ્યામાનંદ ને રાઘવાનંદ<RHYME_210709>, અક્રોધાનંદ ક્રોધ વિના.
gujarati.context: The couplet describes four beings with divine names: Bhagvadanand, Shivanand, Shaumanand, and Ragavanand, who are free from worldly attachments and desires, respectively. They have transcended human emotions and are one with the divine.

gujarati.couplet:
તત્ત્વાનંદ ત્રિવિક્રમાનંદ<RHYME_210711>, ત્રિક્રમાનંદ તદરૂપ છે; 
નિજાનંદ નિજબોધાનંદ<RHYME_210711>, સચ્ચિદાનંદ સ્વરૂપ છે.
gujarati.context: The divine is pleased with the one who pleases themselves; true happiness comes from being true to oneself.

gujarati.couplet:
નિયમાનંદ નિર્માનાનંદ<RHYME_210712>, નિર્લોભાનંદ નિષ્કામજી; 
નિઃસ્વાદાનંદ નિઃસ્પૃહાનંદ<RHYME_210712>, નરનારાયણાનંદ નામજી.
gujarati.context: The joy is found in following one's duty, being detached from worldly attachments, and having a pure mind; it's also about the bliss of renouncing worldly desires and being named after Lord Narayan.

gujarati.couplet:
કલ્યાણાનંદ કૌશિકાનંદ<RHYME_210714>, જિજ્ઞાસાનંદ જુક્તાનંદ જે; 
જક્તખંડાનંદ જગદીશાનંદ<RHYME_210714>, ચિન્મયાનંદ ચિદાનંદ તે.
gujarati.context: The couplet describes the joys of finding inner peace and happiness, which arise from self-reflection, spiritual pursuits, and a connection with the divine. It celebrates the bliss that comes from embracing one's true nature and aligning oneself with the universe.

gujarati.couplet:
ઈશ્વરાનંદ પરમેશ્વરાનંદ<RHYME_210715>, બળભદ્રાનંદ નામ બહુજી; 
દયાનંદ દયાળાનંદ<RHYME_210715>, ભજનાનંદ એ સહુજી.
gujarati.context: The bliss of God's presence is celebrated in various forms: as joy, strength, and playfulness. Devotion to God brings ultimate happiness and unity with the divine.

gujarati.couplet:
હર્યાનંદ નરહર્યાનંદ<RHYME_210717>, ધર્માનંદ પરમધર્માનંદ તે; 
પુરુષોત્તમાનંદ પ્રકાશાનંદ<RHYME_210717>, ત્યાગાનંદ જગવંદ જે.
gujarati.context: The couplet describes someone as blessed with the bliss of the divine (Har-yanand), the delight of devotion (Dharm-anand), and the radiant light of self-realization (Purushottam-anand). This person has renounced worldly attachments and is now absorbed in the divine joy.

gujarati.couplet:
સિદ્ધાનંદ સત્યેશ્વરાનંદ<RHYME_210718>, શંકરાનંદ સુજાણ છે; 
સજ્જનાનંદ ને સત્યાનંદ<RHYME_210718>, કૃપાનંદ મળે કલ્યાણ છે.
gujarati.context: The couplet describes the joyful and peaceful nature of those who have reached spiritual enlightenment, with their souls rejoicing in truth and receiving divine blessings. This state is characterized by a sense of calm and inner peace, bringing good fortune to those who attain it.

gujarati.couplet:
કેશવાનંદ કપિલેશ્વરાનંદ<RHYME_210719>, પ્રભુતાનંદ પ્રવીણજી; 
માધવાનંદ મહાપુરુષાનંદ<RHYME_210719>, સત્ક્રિયાનંદ સુખદેણજી.
gujarati.context:
Here is a summary of the Gujarati couplet in English:

Keshavanand, Kapilashwara, and Prabhuwala are great souls, and Madhawanand, Mahapurusha, and Satkriya are bringers of happiness.

gujarati.couplet:
ધીરાનંદ દ્રષ્ટપ્રકાશાનંદ<RHYME_210721>, ધ્યાનાનંદ ધ્યાન ધરે; 
પ્રભાનંદ ને પુરુષાનંદ<RHYME_210721>, સાંખ્યાનંદ આનંદ કરે.
gujarati.context: The couplet describes the different levels of inner peace and contentment that one can achieve through spiritual practices, with increasing degrees of enlightenment and joy. It emphasizes the importance of meditation (dhyan) in reaching a state of true happiness (anand).

gujarati.couplet:
ચિદાનંદ ચિદ્રૂપાનંદ<RHYME_210723>, ભાસ્કરાનંદ ભજે હરિ; 
ઋષભાનંદ રામરત્નાનંદ<RHYME_210723>, યોગેશ્વરાનંદ જાણો ફરી.
gujarati.context: The divine form of God is to be worshipped with a pure heart, and the Lord's mercy can only be understood through spiritual knowledge.

gujarati.couplet:
નિર્ગુણાનંદ સદ્‍ગુણાનંદ<RHYME_210724>, ગુણાતીતાનંદ ગંભીરજી; 
નૃસિંહાનંદ નિર્દ્વન્દ્વાનંદ<RHYME_210724>, નિરાલંબાનંદ મહાધીરજી.
gujarati.context: The couplet describes the ultimate blissful state of a virtuous person, where their joy and happiness are derived from their own inner virtues rather than external circumstances. This state is characterized by contentment, freedom from worldly attachments, and a sense of cosmic connection.

gujarati.couplet:
વિદેહાનંદ નિઃસંદેહાનંદ<RHYME_210726>, નિર્વિકારાનંદજી; 
વિજ્ઞાનાનંદ વિશ્વાસાનંદ<RHYME_210726>, દેવાનંદ સ્વચ્છંદજી.
gujarati.context:
Here is a 1-2 line summarization of the Gujarati couplet:

The joy and happiness that comes from understanding oneself (videhaanand) and letting go of desires (nirvikaraanandjee) is supreme; it's also found in having faith in God's wisdom (vijnanaanand) and being pure and clean (deevaanand swachchhandjee).

gujarati.couplet:
દિવ્યાનંદ [દિત્યાનંદ] વાસુદેવાનંદ<RHYME_210728>, નિરપક્ષાનંદ નચિંતજી; 
ગણેશાનંદ ગોતીતાનંદ<RHYME_210728>, લક્ષ્મણાનંદ અજિતજી.
gujarati.context: The couplet celebrates the joys of divine bliss and spiritual happiness through various forms of devotional expression, including Vasudhaanand, Nirapakshaanand, Ganesaanand, and Lakshmanaanand.

gujarati.couplet:
નિવૃત્તાનંદ નીલકંઠાનંદ<RHYME_210730>, અશોકાનંદ ઓપે ઘણું; 
આજ્ઞાનંદ અવિનાશાનંદ<RHYME_210730>, ભદ્રાનંદ ભાવાનંદ ભણું.
gujarati.context:
Here is a summary of the Gujarati couplet:

True happiness comes from being content with what one has, rather than seeking external pleasures or fleeting joys. Inner peace and fulfillment are found in surrendering to life's natural flow.

gujarati.couplet:
ભવાનાનંદ ને ભૂધરાનંદ<RHYME_210732>, વળી અછેદ્યાત્માનંદ છે; 
માયાતીતાનંદ મંજુકેશાનંદ<RHYME_210732>, રામાનુજાનંદ સુખાનંદ છે.
gujarati.context: The couplet describes the blissful state of a liberated soul, which is unshakeable and free from worldly attachments. It also mentions the joyous union with the ultimate reality, bringing happiness and contentment.

gujarati.couplet:
હંસાનંદ હરિભજનાનંદ<RHYME_210733>, હયગ્રીવાનંદ હરિરૂપ જે; 
પ્રદ્યુમ્નાનંદ પ્રતોષાનંદ<RHYME_210733>, સૂર્યાનંદ સ્વરૂપ જે.
gujarati.context: The joy of the soul is in union with God's bliss and divine form, bringing happiness to all. In this state, one finds true delight and fulfillment.

gujarati.couplet:
નરોત્તમાનંદ નારાયણાનંદ<RHYME_210734>, નિર્મળાનંદ નિર્મળ છે; 
પરમાત્માનંદ પ્રશાંતાનંદ<RHYME_210734>, મુક્તાત્માનંદ અકળ છે.
gujarati.context: The couplet describes the blissful states of being: Narotthanand is a state of joy, while Paramatmanand and Muktaatmanand are states of inner peace and spiritual liberation.

gujarati.couplet:
સવિત્રાનંદ સત્યેશ્વરાનંદ<RHYME_210718>, સુજ્ઞાનંદ સુજાણ છે; 
યજ્ઞનાથાનંદ જ્યોતીશ્વરાનંદ<RHYME_210718>, પ્રબોધાનંદ પ્રમાણ છે.
gujarati.context: The joy of being with God is eternal bliss; the fire of knowledge ignites the light within, guiding us towards goodness and truth.

gujarati.couplet:
રામચંદ્રાનંદ રામેશ્વરાનંદ<RHYME_210735>, રાસમંડળેશ્વરાનંદ કહીએ<RHYME_210708>; 
પ્રભ્વાનંદ પદ્મનાભાનંદ<RHYME_210735>, વળી વિશ્વાત્માનંદ લહીએ<RHYME_210708>.
gujarati.context: The couplet describes the divine blessings of Ramchandra and Prabhu, with their names having a similar sound to "Ram" (divine) and "Prabhu" (lord), signifying their spiritual connection.

gujarati.couplet:
સુદેહાનંદ સર્વજ્ઞાનંદ<RHYME_210736>, સ્વરૂપાનંદ શૂન્યાતીતજી; 
યોગાનંદ જગન્નિવાસાનંદ<RHYME_210736>, અક્ષરરૂપાનંદ અજિતજી.
gujarati.context:
Here is a summary of the Gujarati couplet in English:

The ultimate bliss is to be united with the divine, and this state is achieved through self-realization. This union brings eternal joy and freedom from worldly attachments.

gujarati.couplet:
તાપસાનંદ ત્રિગુણાતિતાનંદ<RHYME_210737>, જગત્પ્રકાશાનંદ જડભરતજી; 
ગવેન્દ્રાનંદ ગોલોકેશ્વરાનંદ<RHYME_210737>, શ્વેતદ્વીપાનંદ સમર્થજી.
gujarati.context: The divine being is filled with joy and bliss, shining brightly in the world and universe. This happiness radiates from within, illuminating all of existence.

gujarati.couplet:
તૂર્યાનંદ તૂર્યાતીતાનંદ<RHYME_210739>, પતિતપાવન નામ છે; 
વામનાનંદ વિવેકાનંદ<RHYME_210739>, દ્રઢવ્રતાનંદ સુખધામ છે.
gujarati.context: The name of the husband is Turyanand, and his wife's name is Patitpavan; together they enjoy a life of strong vows and happiness. Their union is a harmonious blend of spirituality and pleasure.

gujarati.couplet:
શ્રીગુરૂચરણરતાનંદ<RHYME_210740>, નિર્વિશેષાનંદ કહીએ<RHYME_210708>; 
અનિરુદ્ધાનંદ અભેદાનંદ<RHYME_210740>, મધુસૂદનાનંદ લહીએ<RHYME_210708>.
gujarati.context: The couplet is saying that one should be filled with spiritual joy and inner peace (Shri Gurucharan Ratana), and also experience the bliss of unity with the divine (Nirviasha Nand).

gujarati.couplet:
મંગળાનંદ મોહનાનંદ<RHYME_210741>, વળી અવ્યયાત્માનંદ જે; 
સુવ્રતાનંદ સંશીતવ્રતાનંદ<RHYME_210741>, વળી જ્ઞાનવલ્લભાનંદ તે.
gujarati.context: The state of being blessed is one that brings joy and delight, and is achieved by cultivating good habits and gaining spiritual knowledge. This combination leads to a sense of contentment and fulfillment.

gujarati.couplet:
વિચારાનંદ વિશ્વધરાનંદ<RHYME_210742>, જ્ઞાનાનંદ ક્ષેમાનંદ ખરા; 
સુખદાનંદ ઘનશ્યામાનંદ<RHYME_210742>, જિષ્ણવાનંદ યોગેશ્વરા.
gujarati.context: Joy and bliss arise from self-reflection, bringing knowledge, happiness, and prosperity. This state of equanimity is achieved through devotion to the divine.

gujarati.couplet:
અવદાતાનંદ અતિપ્રકાશાનંદ<RHYME_210717>, મુક્તિદાનંદ વરદાનંદ કહીએ<RHYME_210708>; 
સુવર્ણાનંદ શ્રીનિવાસાનંદ<RHYME_210744>, બાળમુકુંદાનંદ લહીએ<RHYME_210708>.
gujarati.context:
Here is a 1-2 line summarization of the Gujarati couplet:

The speaker's heart is filled with joy, freedom, and divine bliss. The beauty of life is reflected in their inner peace and happiness.

gujarati.couplet:
પ્રભાનંદ ભાસ્કરાનંદ, સુશીલાનંદ મનોહરા; 
આકાશનિવાસાનંદ જાણો, પ્રસાદાનંદ નંદ દહરા.
gujarati.context:
Here is a 1-2 line summarization of the Gujarati couplet:

The couplet describes two types of divine happiness: one that comes from understanding the universe (Akasha) and another that arises from receiving divine blessings (Prasada).

gujarati.couplet:
પવિત્રાનંદ પરમકૈવલ્યાનંદ<RHYME_210746>, પદ્મધરાનંદ નરાનંદ છે; 
ભૂમાનંદ ભક્તેશ્વરાનંદ<RHYME_210746>, સત્યધર્માનંદ આનંદ છે.
gujarati.context: The divine joy is the ultimate bliss; it is also found in devotion to God and adherence to truth.

gujarati.couplet:
અનુપમાનંદ અક્ષરનિવાસાનંદ<RHYME_210747>, ગદાધરાનંદ કરુણાનંદ કહીએ<RHYME_210708>; 
શંખધરાનંદ સર્વપ્રકાશાનંદ<RHYME_210747>, વળી સુખપ્રકાશાનંદ લહીએ<RHYME_210708>.
gujarati.context: The lines express joy and bliss in the presence of a wise and compassionate person, saying their words bring delight and happiness. The speaker is filled with gratitude for the wisdom that brings radiance and peace.

gujarati.couplet:
ચિદાકાશાનંદ ચતુરાત્માનંદ<RHYME_210748>, ચતુર્ભુજાનંદ ચવું; 
હિરણ્યગર્ભાનંદ હરિપ્રકાશાનંદ<RHYME_210717>, વંશીધરાનંદ વર્ણવું.
gujarati.context: The couplet describes the joys of being reunited with a loved one in the afterlife, where all worries and sufferings are left behind. It's a celebration of eternal bliss and union with the divine.

gujarati.couplet:
માયાજિતાનંદ પુનિતાનંદ, ધામાનંદ રામશરણાનંદ છે; 
એક એક નામ માંહિ, માનો મુનિનાં વૃંદ છે.
gujarati.context: The couplet describes a person as being blessed by Maya (the universe), Puni (divine knowledge), and Dhaman (heavenly shelter). They are considered part of the noble group, sharing one single name with the Munis (sages).

gujarati.couplet:
પુંડરીકાક્ષાનંદ પ્રધાનપુરુષેશ્વરાનંદ<RHYME_210750>, પ્રાણદાતાનંદ પ્રતાપાનંદ જે; 
પાવનાનંદ પ્રકાશાત્માનંદ<RHYME_210750>, પ્રથિતાનંદ પ્રમેષ્ટાનંદ તે.
gujarati.context: The couplet praises the Lord, expressing joy and gratitude for being blessed with a compassionate leader who brings happiness to all. It also acknowledges the Lord's divine power and omnipresence.

gujarati.couplet:
પ્રમોદાનંદ પુણ્યકીર્ત્યાનંદ<RHYME_210751>, પુણ્યાનંદ કૃતજ્ઞાનંદ કહીએ<RHYME_210708>; 
કારણાનંદ ક્રોધહાનંદ<RHYME_210751>, કુમોદાનંદ લોકાધ્યક્ષાનંદ લહીએ<RHYME_210708>.
gujarati.context:
Joy and bliss arise from righteous deeds, and gratitude fills the heart.
Anger and sorrow subside when one is mindful of their place in the world.

gujarati.couplet:
વિધાત્રાનંદ વિશ્રામાનંદ<RHYME_210752>, વૃષાકપ્યાનંદ વળી; 
વસ્વાનંદ વિશ્વકર્માનંદ<RHYME_210752>, વિશ્વક્સેનાનંદ વેદાનંદ મળી.
gujarati.context: The delight of being alive is the greatest joy, accompanied by the happiness of being together with loved ones; and the bliss of creating something new brings satisfaction in its own right.

gujarati.couplet:
વેદાંતાનંદ વિજયાનંદ<RHYME_210753>, વિશ્રુતાનંદ વિશ્વાનંદ છે; 
વર્ધનાનંદ વિવિક્તાનંદ<RHYME_210753>, વિશિષ્ટાનંદ સ્વચ્છંદ છે.
gujarati.context: He who is victorious in the pursuit of knowledge (Vedant) and in worldly affairs (Vijaya), is also pure and distinguished in his words (Vishrut). He whose words are sweet like nectar (Virhdna) and profound like an ocean, is truly pure and distinguished.

gujarati.couplet:
નિર્મત્સરાનંદ નિર્વૃતાનંદ<RHYME_210754>, ધર્માધ્યક્ષાનંદ ધ્રુવાનંદ છે; 
સ્થિરાનંદ સ્થવિષ્ઠાનંદ<RHYME_210754>, અપ્રમેયાનંદ આનંદ છે.
gujarati.context: Delight in the self is eternal bliss, and delight in one's faith is also eternal bliss. True joy comes from within and through spiritual fulfillment.

gujarati.couplet:
વૃદ્ધપાનંદ વસુદાનંદ<RHYME_210755>, વ્યવસાયાનંદ વિદ્યાનંદ વંદું; 
વિષમાનંદ વિશાલાનંદ<RHYME_210755>, વિમુક્તાનંદ જોઈ આનંદું.
gujarati.context: I find joy in being old, finding work and learning delightful; and in difficulties, I see freedom and experience true happiness.

gujarati.couplet:
વિશોકાનંદ વિશ્વમૂર્ત્યાનંદ<RHYME_210757>, હિરણ્યમયાનંદ હવે; 
નૈકરૂપાનંદ નંદનાનંદ<RHYME_210757>, નંદાનંદ નિષ્કુલાનંદ કવે.
gujarati.context: The soul finds peace in the universe's ananda (bliss) and is now filled with joy. The heart, too, is filled with bliss, free from all worries and attachments.

transliteration.couplet:
Duravāsānā shāpthī, ṛuṣhie dharyā hatā deh; <RHYME_1>
Teh maḷyā chhe Mahārājne, karī atishe saneh.  <RHYME_1>
transliteration.context: The couplet speaks of a person's life being like a worn-out garment (Duravāsānā), and their soul being worn out from the weight of worldly desires; however, Mahārājne is said to be kind and merciful.

transliteration.couplet:
Evā sant shiromaṇi, tenā te kahu have nām; <RHYME_2>
Te sāmbhaḷtā sukh ūpaje, vaḷī pāme param dhām.  <RHYME_2>
transliteration.context: A peaceful soul is blessed, and their name is spoken of with reverence; in happiness, they attain the ultimate abode.

transliteration.couplet:
Moṭā mukta Mahārājnā, Bhāī Rāmdās akām; <RHYME_3>
Panchavratnī mūrati, jene vahālā sundar Shyām.  <RHYME_3>
transliteration.context: The great Mahārāj was freed from worldly desires, and brother Rāmdās remained unsatisfied. His form is like the five-colored gemstone, with beautiful dark blue Shyām as his companion.

transliteration.couplet:
Muktānand chhe nām mukhya, Shukmuni ādi apār; <RHYME_4>
Sundar nām sahu sāmbhaḷo , kahu nām taṇo niradhār.  <RHYME_4>
transliteration.context: The name "Muktānand" is supreme, and Shukmuni and others are numerous; A beautiful name like "Sundar" is abundant, and many names are without end.

transliteration.couplet:
Swarūpānand ne Vyāpkānand, Brahmānand ne Govind; <RHYME_5>
Nityānand ne Chaitanyānand, Shāntānand ne Ānand.  <RHYME_5>
transliteration.context: This Gujarati couplet lists names of sages or spiritual leaders who have achieved a state of supreme bliss and joy, with the rhyme scheme emphasizing the shared experience of divine happiness. The verse highlights the connection between these individuals and their attainment of eternal bliss.

transliteration.couplet:
Shukānand Niranjanānand, Advaitānand e nām chhe; <RHYME_6>
Achyutānand Anantānand, Ātmānand akām chhe.  <RHYME_6>
transliteration.context: The couplet refers to four names of the same divine entity: Shukanand, Nirajanand, Advaitanand, and Atmanand, representing different aspects of spiritual growth.

transliteration.couplet:
Achintyānand ne Amoghānand, Akhanḍānand ajit je; <RHYME_7>
Adbhutānand Arihantrānand, Gopāḷānand brahmavit je.  <RHYME_7>
transliteration.context: The couplet describes two types of supreme beings: Achintyānand, who is infinite and all-conquering, and Adbhutānand, who is wondrous and brings liberation.

transliteration.couplet:
Arūpānand Anubhavānand, Akṣharānand ādhārjī; <RHYME_8>
Aparānand Aṣhṭāvakrānand, Ādityānand udārjī.  <RHYME_8>
transliteration.context: The experience of the formless and the infinite is the foundation for spiritual growth, and the joy derived from it is the true support. The divine radiance that arises from this experience is the source of generosity and selflessness.

transliteration.couplet:
Achaḷānand Avadhūtānand, Ajanmānand Ajitmuni; <RHYME_9>
Akhilānand Amūrtānand, em nand sangnā sahunī.  <RHYME_9>
transliteration.context: The couplet describes two types of enlightened beings: those who have transcended worldly attachment and ego (Achaḷānand Avadhūtānand), and those who possess great wisdom and spiritual insight (Akhilānand Amūrtānand).

transliteration.couplet:
Akhilbrahmānḍeshvarānand, Ākāshānand Ohmkārānandjī; <RHYME_10>
Ek ekmā apār bījā, nāmnā chhe vṛundjī.  <RHYME_10>
transliteration.context: The bliss of the universe's ultimate reality is found in the self, and the name of this bliss is Ohmkār. A single seed contains multiple names, reflecting the complexity of one's true nature.

transliteration.couplet:
Vīryānand Vaiṣhṇavānand, Vishvāschaitanyānand chhe; <RHYME_11>
Vairāgyānand ne Vallabhānand, Vishvarūpānand swachchhand chhe.  <RHYME_11>
transliteration.context: This couplet describes the blissful experiences of two revered saints: Vīryānand and Vishvāschaitanya, who find joy in spiritual pursuits; and Vairāgya and Vallabha, who discover delight in detachment and self-realization.

transliteration.couplet:
Swayamprakāshānand Sadānand, Pragnānand Paramānand vaḷī; <RHYME_12>
Paramchaitanyānand nām, paramahansa boḷā maḷī.  <RHYME_12>
transliteration.context: This couplet speaks of the ultimate bliss of self-realization (Swayamprakāshānand) and spiritual freedom (Sadānand), which is reached through wisdom (Pragnānand) and divine union (Paramānand). It also mentions the highest state of consciousness, Paramchaitanyānand, where one experiences the true self.

transliteration.couplet:
Vedāntānand Vaikunṭhānand, Kaivalyānand Kṛuṣhṇānand kahīe; <RHYME_13>
Mahānubhāvānand Mukundānand, Gnānānand ghaṇā lahīe.  <RHYME_13>
transliteration.context: The couplet describes the ultimate blissful states of self-realization as Vedanta-nand (bliss from spiritual knowledge), Vaikuntha-nand (bliss from the divine), Kaivalya-nand (bliss from liberation), and Krishna-nand (bliss from devotion).

transliteration.couplet:
Bhagwadānand Bhāgeshvarānand, Shivānand bahu sanganyā; <RHYME_14>
Shyāmānand ne Rāghavānand, Akrodhānand krodh vinā.  <RHYME_14>
transliteration.context: This Gujarati couplet describes the peaceful nature of saints Bhagwadānand and Shivānand, who have transcended worldly attachments and emotions like anger.

transliteration.couplet:
Tattvānand Trivikramānand, Trikramānand tadarūp chhe; <RHYME_15>
Nijānand Nijbodhānand, Sachchidānand swarūp chhe.  <RHYME_15>
transliteration.context: The Ultimate Truth (Tattva) and the Self are one, having the same form. The Individual's true nature is the same as the Absolute Reality (Sachchidananda), having its own distinct form.

transliteration.couplet:
Niyamānand Nirmānānand, Nirlobhānand Niṣhkāmjī; <RHYME_16>
Nihswādānand Nihspṛuhānand, Narnārāyaṇānand nāmjī.  <RHYME_16>
transliteration.context: The couplet describes four types of enlightened individuals: those who follow rules, are free from desires and worldly attachments, have no attachment to the self, and have transcended all material and emotional struggles. These individuals are named after Lord Narayana.

transliteration.couplet:
Kalyāṇānand Kaushikānand, Jignāsānand Juktānand je; <RHYME_17>
Jaktakhanḍānand Jagadīshānand, Chinmayānand chidānand te.  <RHYME_17>
transliteration.context: The couplet praises the blissful state of those who have achieved spiritual happiness through devotion to God, described as Kalyan-Anand and others. Their joy is eternal and all-pervading, like the divine presence of Jagadishwar and Chinmay.

transliteration.couplet:
Īshvarānand Parmeshvarānand, Baḷabhadrānand nām bahujī; <RHYME_18>
Dayānand Dayāḷānand, Bhajanānand e sahujī.  <RHYME_18>
transliteration.context: The couplet praises three types of bliss: the divine (Ishwaranand), the omnipresent (Parmeshwaranand), and the blessed (Baibhadraranand). It also highlights two more forms of bliss, one for those who follow a path of compassion (Dayanand) and another for those who engage in devotional activities (Bhajanandan).

transliteration.couplet:
Haryānand Narharyānand, Dharmānand Paramdharmānand te; <RHYME_19>
Puruṣhottamānand Prakāshānand, Tyāgānand jagvand je.  <RHYME_19>
transliteration.context: The couplet praises God by addressing various aspects of His divine nature, describing Him as Haryānand and beyond, all the way to Paramdharmānand, and emphasizing His radiant presence and self-sacrificing love.

transliteration.couplet:
Siddhānand Satyeshvarānand, Shankarānand sujāṇ chhe; <RHYME_20>
Sajjanānand ne Satyānand, Kṛupānand maḷe kalyāṇ chhe.  <RHYME_20>
transliteration.context: These couplets praise the virtuous individuals Siddhanand, Satyeshvaranand, Shankaranand, and Sajjananand, highlighting their pious and benevolent nature.

transliteration.couplet:
Keshavānand Kapileshvarānand, Prabhutānand pravīṇjī; <RHYME_21>
Mādhavānand Mahāpuruṣhānand, Satkriyānand sukhdeṇjī.  <RHYME_21>
transliteration.context: This couplet praises two great spiritual leaders: Keshavānand and Prabhutānand, known for their profound wisdom and enlightening teachings; Mādhavānand and Mahāpuruṣhānand, renowned for their selfless service and bringing joy to others.

transliteration.couplet:
Dhīrānand Draṣhṭaprakāshānand, Dhyānānand dhyān dhare; <RHYME_22>
Prabhānand ne Puruṣhānand, Sānkhyānand ānand kare.  <RHYME_22>
transliteration.context: The couplet describes the blissful states of four individuals: Dhīrānand's manifestation of divine light, Dhyānānand's absorption in meditation, Prabhānand's union with the supreme being, and Sānkhyānand's attainment of ultimate joy.

transliteration.couplet:
Chidānand Chidrūpānand, Bhāskarānand bhaje Hari; <RHYME_23>
Ṛuṣhabhānand Rāmratnānand, Yogeshvarānand jāṇo farī.  <RHYME_23>
transliteration.context:
I realize Gujarati couplets can be challenging to summarize! Here's a attempt:

I worship Hari (Vishnu) with joy and bliss, while knowing the true Self through spiritual wisdom. I also know and understand Yogeshvar, the Lord of Yoga, as well as Rāmratna, a treasure of Rama (God).

transliteration.couplet:
Nirguṇānand Sadguṇānand, Guṇātītānand gambhīrjī; <RHYME_24>
Nṛusinhānand Nirdvandvānand, Nirālambānand mahādhīrjī.  <RHYME_24>
transliteration.context: The couplet describes the bliss of being free from worldly attachments and desires (nirguṇānand), and having a deep understanding of the self and the universe (sadguṇānand). This understanding transcends all dualities, limitations, and doubts, bringing great joy and wisdom.

transliteration.couplet:
Videhānand Nihsandehānand, Nirvikārānandjī; <RHYME_25>
Vignānānand Vishvāsānand, Devānand swachchhandjī.  <RHYME_25>
transliteration.context: The couplet describes the bliss of a self-realized person as being unshakeable and pure in their joy, wisdom, and faith. This individual's happiness is rooted in their connection with the divine and is untainted by worldly desires.

transliteration.couplet:
Divyānand [Dityānand] Vāsudevānand, Nirpakṣhānand nachintjī; <RHYME_26>
Gaṇeshānand Gotītānand, Lakṣhmaṇānand ajitjī.  <RHYME_26>
transliteration.context: The couplet lists names of saints, including Divyānand and Gaṇeshānand, who are praised for their spiritual achievements and inner peace.

transliteration.couplet:
Nivṛuttānand Nīlkanṭhānand, Ashokānand ope ghaṇu; <RHYME_27>
Āgnānand Avināshānand, Bhadrānand Bhāvānand bhaṇu.  <RHYME_27>
transliteration.context: Joy from renunciation and the bliss of Lord Krishna's love bring endless happiness. The eternal joys of self-realization, divine love, and devotion also fill one's life with delight.

transliteration.couplet:
Bhavānānand ne Bhūdharānand, vaḷī Achhedyātmānand chhe; <RHYME_28>
Māyātītānand Manjukeshānand, Rāmānujānand Sukhānand chhe.  <RHYME_28>
transliteration.context:
The summarization is:

"The blissful experiences of Bhavananand and Budharanand are infinite; their souls are filled with eternal joy."

transliteration.couplet:
Hansānand Haribhajanānand, Hayagrīvānand harirūp je; <RHYME_29>
Pradyumnānand Pratoṣhānand, Sūryānand swarūp je.  <RHYME_29>
transliteration.context: This Gujarati couplet describes the divine forms of four gods: Hanuman, Hari Bhajanand, Hayagriva, and Pradyumna; each is associated with their respective original or true forms.

transliteration.couplet:
Narottamānand Nārāyaṇānand, Nirmaḷānand nirmaḷ chhe; <RHYME_30>
Paramātmānand Prashāntānand, Muktātmānand akaḷ chhe.  <RHYME_30>
transliteration.context: The couplet compares the joys of worldly pleasure (Narottamānand) and spiritual bliss (Nārāyaṇānand), with the first being fleeting and the second eternal. It also contrasts the calmness of self-realization (Paramātmānand) with the peace that comes from liberation (Muktātmānand).

transliteration.couplet:
Savitrānand Satyeshvarānand, Sugnānand sujāṇ chhe; <RHYME_31>
Yagnanāthānand Jyotīshvarānand, Prabodhānand pramāṇ chhe.  <RHYME_31>
transliteration.context:
Here is a 1-2 line summarization:

The couplet praises the divine energies of Savitr and Satyeshvar, along with Sugn and Sujata. It also honors Yagnanath's wisdom and light-giving power.

transliteration.couplet:
Rāmchandrānand Rāmeshvarānand, Rāsmanḍaḷeshvarānand kahīe; <RHYME_32>
Prabhvānand Padmanābhānand, vaḷī Vishvātmānand lahīe.  <RHYME_32>
transliteration.context: The couplet is about two individuals, Rāmchandrānand and Prabhvānand, who have achieved spiritual advancement under the guidance of their respective gurus, Rāsmanḍaḷeshvarānand and Padmanābhānand.

transliteration.couplet:
Sudehānand Sarvagnānand, Swarūpānand shūnyātītjī; <RHYME_33>
Yogānand Jagannivāsānand, Akṣharrūpānand ajitjī.  <RHYME_33>
transliteration.context: The couplet describes the blissful states of a yogi who has transcended material attachment and achieved union with the ultimate reality, being filled with divine joy and peace. This state is characterized by an absence of ego and a sense of oneness with the universe.

transliteration.couplet:
Tāpasānand Triguṇātitānand, Jagatprakāshānand Jaḍbharatjī; <RHYME_34>
Gavendrānand Golokeshvarānand, Shvetdvīpānand samarthjī.  <RHYME_34>
transliteration.context: The couplet describes four ultimate realities: Tapasānand represents the bliss of self-realization, Triguṇātitānand symbolizes the unity of three gunas (qualities), Jagatprakāshānand signifies the divine light that reveals the universe, and Jaḍbharatjī represents the self-realized individual who has conquered the world.

transliteration.couplet:
Tūryānand Tūryātītānand, patitpāvan nām chhe; <RHYME_35>
Vāmanānand Vivekānand, Draḍhavratānand sukhdhām chhe.  <RHYME_35>
transliteration.context: The couplet describes two great saints: Turyanand and Turiatitinand, whose names are synonymous with renunciation; and Vamananand and Vivekanand, who have achieved the ultimate state of bliss.

transliteration.couplet:
Shrīgurūcharaṇratānand, Nirvisheṣhānand kahīe; <RHYME_36>
Aniruddhānand Abhedānand, Madhusūdanānand lahīe.  <RHYME_36>
transliteration.context:
Here is a 1-2 line summary:

The bliss of divine service and the happiness of worldly pleasures are two different things; the joy that transcends all dualities is the greatest joy. The joy of selfless service, unity with the divine, and the destruction of ego are even greater joys.

transliteration.couplet:
Mangaḷānand Mohanānand, vaḷī Avyayātmānand je; <RHYME_37>
Suvratānand Sanshītvratānand, vaḷī Gnānvallabhānand te.  <RHYME_37>
transliteration.context: Mangal and Mohan are two aspects of the same divine being, Avyaya-atma. Similarly, Suvrata and Shishitvrita are two paths that lead to the attainment of Gnan-vallabha.

transliteration.couplet:
Vichārānand Vishvadharānand, Gnānānand Kṣhemānand kharā; <RHYME_38>
Sukhadānand Ghanshyāmānand, Jiṣhṇavānand yogeshvarā.  <RHYME_38>
transliteration.context:
Here is a summary of the couplet:

The joys of contemplation, universe, knowledge, and well-being are all intertwined, bringing happiness. The bliss of good fortune, spiritual practices, and union with the divine brings joy and enlightenment.

transliteration.couplet:
Avadātānand Atiprakāshānand, Muktidānand Vardānand kahīe; <RHYME_39>
Suvarṇānand Shrīnivāsānand, Bāḷmukundānand lahīe.  <RHYME_39>
transliteration.context: The couplet describes two individuals: Avadātānand and Atiprakāshānand, along with Muktidānand and Vardānand; and Suvarṇānand and Shrīnivāsānand, along with Bāḷmukundānand.

transliteration.couplet:
Prabhānand Bhāskarānand, Sushīlānand manoharā; <RHYME_40>
Ākāshnivāsānand jāṇo, Prasādānand nand daharā.  <RHYME_40>
transliteration.context:
Here is a summary of the Gujarati couplet:

Prabhūnand Bhāskarānand and Sushīlānand are two beautiful souls; knowing the joy of living in heaven, they receive God's pleasure in their hearts.

transliteration.couplet:
Pavitrānand Paramkaivalyānand, Padmadharānand Narānand chhe; <RHYME_41>
Bhūmānand Bhakteshvarānand, Satyadharmānand ānand chhe.  <RHYME_41>
transliteration.context: The couplet describes four states of divine bliss: purity (Pavitrānand), highest spiritual ecstasy (Paramkaivalyānand), union with the divine (Padmadharānand Narānand), and complete joy (Bhūmānand Bhakteshvarānand).

transliteration.couplet:
Anupamānand Akṣharnivāsānand, Gadādharānand Karuṇānand kahīe; <RHYME_42>
Shankhadharānand Sarvaprakāshānand, vaḷī Sukhprakāshānand lahīe.  <RHYME_42>
transliteration.context: The couplet describes four types of bliss: the joy of abundance, the happiness of homecoming, the compassion of a loving friend, and the illumination of all-knowing wisdom. These joys bring infinite happiness to those who experience them.

transliteration.couplet:
Chidākāshānand Chaturātmānand, Chaturbhujānand chavu; <RHYME_43>
Hiraṇyagarbhānand Hariprakāshānand, Vanshīdharānand varṇavu.  <RHYME_43>
transliteration.context: The couplet describes the blissful union of Lord Krishna with Radha, where both souls merge into one, bringing infinite joy and happiness. This supreme love is beyond human comprehension and understanding.

transliteration.couplet:
Māyājitānand Punitānand, Dhāmānand Rāmsharaṇānand chhe; <RHYME_44>
Ek ek nām māhi, māno muninā vṛund chhe.  <RHYME_44>
transliteration.context: The couplet refers to four saints: Māyājitānand, Punitānand, Dhāmānand, and Rāmsharaṇānand, who are all considered one in unity. Each name is like a drop of ocean, where the individual "drops" (names) merge into the vastness of the universe.

transliteration.couplet:
Punḍarīkākṣhānand Pradhānpuruṣheshvarānand, Prāṇdātānand Pratāpānand je; <RHYME_45>
Pāvanānand Prakāshātmānand, Prathitānand Prameṣhṭānand te.  <RHYME_45>
transliteration.context: Joy is found in the self-realization of one's true nature, as well as in the pleasure and delight experienced through spiritual growth and connection with the divine. This joy is further enhanced by the blissful state of being one with the universe and its rhythms.

transliteration.couplet:
Pramodānand Puṇyakīrtyānand, Puṇyānand Kṛutagnānand kahīe; <RHYME_46>
Kāraṇānand Krodhahānand, Kumodānand Lokādhyakṣhānand lahīe.  <RHYME_46>
transliteration.context:
Here is a 1-2 line summary of the Gujarati couplet:

The names of five divine figures are mentioned: Pramodanand, Puynakirtyanand, Punyanand, Krutagnanand, and Karananand. Each name is associated with a type of joy or bliss: happiness, virtue, forgiveness, and spiritual guidance.

transliteration.couplet:
Vidhātrānand Vishrāmānand, Vṛuṣhākapyānand vaḷī; <RHYME_47>
Vaswānand Vishvakarmānand, Vishvaksenānand Vedānand maḷī.  <RHYME_47>
transliteration.context: This couplet celebrates the names of four divine beings: Vidhatra, Vishrama, Vrusha, and Vaswanand, emphasizing their connection to the universe and knowledge. The rhyming scheme highlights the musical quality of the Gujarati language.

transliteration.couplet:
Vedāntānand Vijayānand, Vishrutānand Vishvānand chhe; <RHYME_48>
Vardhanānand Viviktānand, Vishiṣhṭānand swachchhand chhe.  <RHYME_48>
transliteration.context:
Here is a summary of the Gujarati couplet:

The ultimate bliss is achieved by understanding Vedānta's truth and living a life of self-realization. It's about finding inner peace and purity through spiritual growth.

transliteration.couplet:
Nirmatsarānand Nirvṛutānand, Dharmādhyakṣhānand Dhruvānand chhe; <RHYME_49>
Sthirānand Sthaviṣhṭhānand, Aprameyānand ānand chhe.  <RHYME_49>
transliteration.context: The couplet describes the four types of bliss one can experience: eternal joy (Nirmatsarānand), unobstructed joy (Nirvṛutānand), guidance through dharma (Dharmādhyakṣhānand), and the joy of steady progress (Dhruvānand).

transliteration.couplet:
Vṛuddhapānand Vasudānand, Vyavasāyānand Vidyānand vandu; <RHYME_50>
Viṣhamānand Vishālānand, Vimuktānand joī ānandu.  <RHYME_50>
transliteration.context: This couplet praises four types of bliss: worldly happiness (Vasudānand), emotional fulfillment (Vyavasāyānand), knowledge and understanding (Vidyānand), and spiritual liberation (Vimuktānand). It concludes by seeking joy in these states.

transliteration.couplet:
Vishokānand Vishvamūrtyānand, Hiraṇyamayānand have; <RHYME_51>
Naikarūpānand Nandanānand, Nandānand Niṣhkulānand kave.  <RHYME_51>
transliteration.context: The couplet describes the attainment of four types of bliss: Vishoka, Vishwa, Hiraanya, and Naika, which are experienced by the poet through their writing. The poem itself is a celebration of this creative expression, bringing joy and happiness to others.
